titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Irwin Everitt Winship (1925-1995) was a missionary in the Philippines. Winship served in Cebu City and the Visayan Islands. Winship conducted in-service training for ministers and lay leaders working with patients in a leprosarium. He was a graduate of Montana State University and the San Francisco Theological Seminary. While on furlough in 1957, he earned a Th.M degree from Princeton Theological Seminary. His wife, Merilyn Strong Winship (b. 1927) was also a missionary in the Philippines and a graduate of Montana State University. She earned a Master's degree from San Francisco Theological Seminary. She worked at Bethany Hospital, conducting a weekly audio-visual program for patients, staff, and visitors.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of the Winship family. Materials include: reports and papers on missionary work in Philippines and East Asia (various authors, including Winship, many of the papers read at Mission Conferences, 1925-1960); Winship's personal statement to the Presbytery of Kalispell as part of his work towards licensure and ordination; articles and background information about Philippines, Cebu City, and Protestantism and evangelical faith in the Philippines; clippings and architectural drawings of Presbyterian Church in Cebu, Philippines, and a plan of Presbyterian Mission property; minutes of meetings of the cabinet of the Visayan Jurisdiction of the UCCP and of the Philippine Mission of the Presbyterian Church of the USA; minutes, correspondence, and other papers related to Winship's work in Cebu, including papers relating to the Cebu Institute and the Kian Kee High School; and pamphlets and magazines, including items printed by Philippine Agency of the American Bible Society, the Board of Foreign Missions, and others. The collection also includes: photographs, including students at Silliman Bible School, mission meetings in Manila, missionary families/mission personnel (pictures are from Presbyterian Mission and United Church of Christ in the Philippines organizations); obituaries and memorial minutes for various missionaries, including Merne Graham; and a small collection of school papers of Marilyn Winship.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
